boardgame.description: For Sale is a quick, fun game nominally about buying and selling real estate. During the game's two distinct phases, players first bid for several buildings then, after all buildings have been bought, sell the buildings for the greatest profit possible._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The original Ravensburger/FX Schmid edition (1997/98) has slightly different rules than later English editions, and only 20 buildings instead of 30._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Überplay 2005 Edition has new art, rules and card distribution changes, and it accommodates 3-6 players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The Gryphon 2009 Edition uses the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;Uuml;berplay art for the faces of the property cards, while replacing most other art. The rules are the same as the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;Uuml;berplay edition, with the exception of the rounding rule (which was stated in different ways in different printings of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;Uuml;berplay edition)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Rounding rule_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The rounding rule preferred by the designer Stefan Dorra is that players get back half of their bid rounded DOWN (not UP), as confirmed in correspondence with him here and here. A history of how the rounding rule has changed in different editions is documented here._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

played only once +++++ german version, but game components are completely language independent and you can download a rules translation from bgg +++++ will be shipped insured +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia and australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have no euro : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : direct bank transfer (wich is cost-free !) or cash (by letter) +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ international buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly are not cheap (about 19 - 45 euros, it depends on where the parcel has to be shipped and it´s weight), so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ shipment inside germany costs 8 euros

Wojciechowski (Chicago, IL USA) For Sale is a short and deceptively simple game. The rules can be explained in 5 minutes, and the game can be played in about 10 minutes. (We tend to play several rounds and total our scores to determine a winner.) Still, while anyone can be taught to play, the simple mechanism of two rounds of bidding hide opportunities for some clever strategies. The small size make this game a natural for travel, camping, etc. I recommend For Sale as a tool for introducing new gamers to the wider world of non-traditional games. FRED Distribution (FDD 101124N) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Everyone I play with enjoys it - it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the kind of game that you sit around wishing you had designed._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; - Tom Vasel of The Dice Tower Bid and bluff your way to purchase the most valuable real estate for the lowest amount of money, then turn around and sell those houses (and shacks) for cold hard cash. Be the richest mogul at the end of the game to win this Stefan Dorra classic, which will be released in January of 2009. Considered one of the finest bidding games of all time, For Sale has a devoted following of fans that is about to grow much larger as FRED Distribution publishes the newest edition of this game as part of its Gryphon Games series. For 3-6 players ages 8 and up, this 20 minute game may seem short, but expect your gaming group to decide that there is time for _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;just one more play!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Game Summary: Going once! Going twice! Sold to the highest bidder! In this perfectly-crafted bidding game, players are forced to make a multitude of difficult decisions every minute - and that’s just in the first phase of the game! During phase one, players must decide how much of their spending capital to invest in available properties, knowing that their own actions in the second phase could turn those properties into extremely lucrative bargains or crushing losses. Game Contents: 30 Property Cards 30 Check Cards 60 $1,000 Chips 12 $2,000 Chips 1 Rulebook

[size=14][b][u]Comments:[/u][/b][/size] To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y . Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know. [size=14][b][u]Condition Notes:[/u][/b][/size] Smoke-free home. Still in shrinkwrap. [b][u]Edition Notes:[/u][/b] English. [size=14][b][u]Shipping Notes:[/u][/b][/size] Ask me about how you can create an order where there will be no charge to ship this item as an add-on item if you purchase a big-box game at the same time. I am willing to meet you at one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) to make the exchange in person which would reduce your shipping cost to $0.00. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y). When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, please provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) shipping address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this may expedite delivery). [size=14][b][u]Payment Notes:[/u][/b][/size] **Note that the listed offered price includes a small discount for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment. I cannot include the discount for payments made via Paypal. [b][i]US buyers:[/i][/b] When placing the order, let me know if you would like to purchase the optional insurance offered by the shipping company. I cannot remember ever having any material problems, but theoretically there is some risk. If the receiver (you) does NOT request (and does NOT pay extra for) insurance (decision is totally up to you) then the receiver (you) agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. I know that this paragraph sounds scary, but my lawyer makes me include this -- again, this is probably a non-issue -- I have never had a package that I shipped go missing and think that I have had two people mention extremely minor blemishes incurred during shipping in the last 600 BGG items that I have shipped.
